title: 2 of this Order, as to the matters specified in subsection (2) of the said section
heading: 1. (1) This Order may be cited as the International Protection Act 2015 (Safe
text_raw:
1. (1) This Order may be cited as the International Protection Act 2015 (Safe 

Countries of Origin) (Amendment) (No.2) Order 2024. 

(2) This Order comes into operation on 03 July 2024.
text_norm: 1 (1) order may cited international protection act 2015 (safe country origin) (amendment) (no.2) order 2024 (2) order come operation 03 july 2024

title: 2 of this Order, as to the matters specified in subsection (2) of the said section
heading: 2. The Schedule to the International Protection Act 2015 (Safe Countries of
text_raw:
2. The Schedule to the International Protection Act 2015 (Safe Countries of 

Origin) Order 2018 (S.I. No. 121 of 2018)) is amended - 

(a) 

by the insertion of “Arab Republic of Egypt” before “Bosnia and 
Herzegovina”, 

(b) by the insertion of “Federative Republic of Brazil” after “Bosnia 

and Herzegovina”, 

(c) 

by the insertion of “Kingdom of Morocco” after “Georgia”, 

and 

(d) by the insertion of “Republic of India” and “Republic of Malawi” 

after “Republic of Botswana”. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

1 July, 2024. 

HELEN MCENTEE, 
Minister for Justice. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
"Iris Oifigiúil" of 5th July, 2024. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [327] 3

title: 2 of this Order, as to the matters specified in subsection (2) of the said section
heading: (This is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

This Order amends the Schedule to the International Protection Act 2015 (Safe 
Countries of Origin) Order 2018. The Order adds the Arab Republic of Egypt, 
Federative Republic of Brazil, Kingdom of Morocco, Republic of India and 
Republic of Malawi to the designated list of Safe Countries of Origin under 
section 72 of the International Protection Act 2015.
